title: Make WriteTask pooling virtual thread friendly
body:
Adding `-Djdk.traceVirtualThreadLocals=true` to a test with Netty 4.2 + Virtual Thread handling a `writeAndFlush` this is reported: 
```
VirtualThread[#65]/runnable@multithreadVirtualEventExecutorGroup-2-1
    java.base/java.lang.ThreadLocal.setInitialValue(ThreadLocal.java:236)
    java.base/java.lang.ThreadLocal.get(ThreadLocal.java:194)
    java.base/java.lang.ThreadLocal.get(ThreadLocal.java:172)
    io.netty.util.internal.InternalThreadLocalMap.slowGet(InternalThreadLocalMap.java:130)
    io.netty.util.internal.InternalThreadLocalMap.get(InternalThreadLocalMap.java:117)
    io.netty.util.concurrent.FastThreadLocal.get(FastThreadLocal.java:136)
    io.netty.util.Recycler.get(Recycler.java:180)
    io.netty.util.internal.ObjectPool$RecyclerObjectPool.get(ObjectPool.java:86)
    io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext$WriteTask.newInstance(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:1096)
    io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext.write(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:844)
    io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext.writeAndFlush(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:807)
    io.netty.loom.MultithreadVirtualEventExecutorGroupTest$1$1.lambda$channelRead$0(MultithreadVirtualEventExecutorGroupTest.java:77)
    java.base/java.lang.VirtualThread.run(VirtualThread.java:409)
VirtualThread[#65]/runnable@multithreadVirtualEventExecutorGroup-2-1
    java.base/java.lang.ThreadLocal.set(ThreadLocal.java:253)
    io.netty.util.internal.InternalThreadLocalMap.slowGet(InternalThreadLocalMap.java:133)
    io.netty.util.internal.InternalThreadLocalMap.get(InternalThreadLocalMap.java:117)
    io.netty.util.concurrent.FastThreadLocal.get(FastThreadLocal.java:136)
    io.netty.util.Recycler.get(Recycler.java:180)
    io.netty.util.internal.ObjectPool$RecyclerObjectPool.get(ObjectPool.java:86)
    io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext$WriteTask.newInstance(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:1096)
    io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext.write(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:844)
    io.netty.channel.AbstractChannelHandlerContext.writeAndFlush(AbstractChannelHandlerContext.java:807)
    io.netty.loom.MultithreadVirtualEventExecutorGroupTest$1$1.lambda$channelRead$0(MultithreadVirtualEventExecutorGroupTest.java:77)
    java.base/java.lang.VirtualThread.run(VirtualThread.java:409)

```
Which means that, beside fixing the Netty allocator (adaptive is on the right path) - we need to fix the other pooling mechanisms out there.
